Retrieved <span class="nowrap">21 October</span> 2008</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=Talking+Politics%3A+The+West+Lothian+Question&amp;rft.date=1998-06-01&amp;rft.aulast=Taylor&amp;rft.aufirst=Brian&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.bbc.co.uk%2F1%2Fhi%2Fuk_politics%2Ftalking_politics%2F82358.stm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-bbcnews250313-206"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-bbcnews250313_206-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation news"><a class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-21920010" rel="nofollow">"England-only laws \'need majority from English MPs<span class="cs1-kern-right">\'</span>"</a>. BBC News. 25 March 2013<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">28 April</span> 2013</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=England-only+laws+%27need+majority+from+English+MPs%27&amp;rft.date=2013-03-25&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bbc.co.uk%2Fnews%2Fuk-politics-21920010&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-207"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-207">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation news"><a class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/events/scotland_99/the_scottish_parliament/310036.stm" rel="nofollow">"Scotland\'s Parliament&#160;&#8211; powers and structures"</a>. BBC News. 8 April 1999<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">21 October</span> 2008</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=Scotland%27s+Parliament+%E2%80%93+powers+and+structures&amp;rft.date=1999-04-08&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.bbc.co.uk%2F1%2Fhi%2Fevents%2Fscotland_99%2Fthe_scottish_parliament%2F310036.stm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-bbc-result-208"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-bbc-result_208-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation news"><a class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/events/scotland-decides/results" rel="nofollow">"Scotland Votes No"</a>. BBC News. 19 September 2014<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">4 August</span> 2017</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=Scotland+Votes+No&amp;rft.date=2014-09-19&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bbc.co.uk%2Fnews%2Fevents%2Fscotland-decides%2Fresults&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-209"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-209">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation news"><a class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/events/wales_99/the_welsh_assembly/309033.stm" rel="nofollow">"Structure and powers of the Assembly"</a>. BBC News. 9 April 1999<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">21 October</span> 2008</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=Structure+and+powers+of+the+Assembly&amp;rft.date=1999-04-09&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.bbc.co.uk%2F1%2Fhi%2Fevents%2Fwales_99%2Fthe_welsh_assembly%2F309033.stm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-northernireland1-210"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-northernireland1_210-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a class="external text" href="https://www.northernireland.gov.uk/topics/your-executive" rel="nofollow">"Your Executive"</a>. Northern Ireland Executive. 25 September 2015.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Your+Executive&amp;rft.pub=Northern+Ireland+Executive&amp;rft.date=2015-09-25&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.northernireland.gov.uk%2Ftopics%2Fyour-executive&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-211"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-211">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation journal">Burrows, N. (1999). "Unfinished Business: The Scotland Act 1998". <i>The Modern Law Review</i>. <b>62</b> (2): 241&#8211;260 [p. 249]. <a href="/wiki/Digital_object_identifier" title="Digital object identifier">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="//doi.org/10.1111%2F1468-2230.00203" rel="nofollow">10.1111/1468-2230.00203</a>. <q>The UK Parliament is sovereign and the Scottish Parliament is subordinate. The White Paper had indicated that this was to be the approach taken in the legislation. The Scottish Parliament is not to be seen as a reflection of the settled will of the people of Scotland or of popular sovereignty but as a reflection of its subordination to a higher legal authority. Following the logic of this argument, the power of the Scottish Parliament to legislate can be withdrawn or overridden...</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Modern+Law+Review&amp;rft.atitle=Unfinished+Business%3A+The+Scotland+Act+1998&amp;rft.volume=62&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.pages=241-260+p.+249&amp;rft.date=1999&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1111%2F1468-2230.00203&amp;rft.aulast=Burrows&amp;rft.aufirst=N.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-212"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-212">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation journal">Elliot, M. (2004). "United Kingdom: Parliamentary sovereignty under pressure". <i>International Journal of Constitutional Law</i>. <b>2</b> (3): 545&#8211;627, 553&#8211;554. <a href="/wiki/Digital_object_identifier" title="Digital object identifier">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="//doi.org/10.1093%2Ficon%2F2.3.545" rel="nofollow">10.1093/icon/2.3.545</a>. <q>Notwithstanding substantial differences among the schemes, an important common factor is that the U.K. Parliament has not renounced legislative sovereignty in relation to the three nations concerned. For example, the Scottish Parliament is empowered to enact primary legislation on all matters, save those in relation to which competence is explicitly denied&#160;... but this power to legislate on what may be termed "devolved matters" is concurrent with the Westminster Parliament\'s general power to legislate for Scotland on any matter at all, including devolved matters&#160;... In theory, therefore, Westminster may legislate on Scottish devolved matters whenever it chooses...</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Constitutional+Law&amp;rft.atitle=United+Kingdom%3A+Parliamentary+sovereignty+under+pressure&amp;rft.volume=2&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.pages=545-627%2C+553-554&amp;rft.date=2004&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1093%2Ficon%2F2.3.545&amp;rft.aulast=Elliot&amp;rft.aufirst=M.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-213"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-213">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation journal">Walker, G. (2010). "Scotland, Northern Ireland, and Devolution, 1945&#8211;1979". <i>Journal of British Studies</i>. <b>39</b> (1): 117&#8211;142. <a href="/wiki/Digital_object_identifier" title="Digital object identifier">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="//doi.org/10.1086%2F644536" rel="nofollow">10.1086/644536</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+British+Studies&amp;rft.atitle=Scotland%2C+Northern+Ireland%2C+and+Devolution%2C+1945%E2%80%931979&amp;rft.volume=39&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=117-142&amp;rft.date=2010&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1086%2F644536&amp;rft.aulast=Walker&amp;rft.aufirst=G.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-214"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-214">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation journal">Gamble, A. (2006). "The Constitutional Revolution in the United Kingdom". <i>Publius</i>. <b>36</b> (1): 19&#8211;35 [p. 29]. <a href="/wiki/Digital_object_identifier" title="Digital object identifier">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="//doi.org/10.1093%2Fpublius%2Fpjj011" rel="nofollow">10.1093/publius/pjj011</a>. <q>The British parliament has the power to abolish the Scottish parliament and the Welsh assembly by a simple majority vote in both houses, but since both were sanctioned by referenda, it would be politically difficult to abolish them without the sanction of a further vote by the people. In this way, several of the constitutional measures introduced by the Blair government appear to be entrenched and not subject to a simple exercise of parliamentary sovereignty at Westminster.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Publius&amp;rft.atitle=The+Constitutional+Revolution+in+the+United+Kingdom&amp;rft.volume=36&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=19-35+p.+29&amp;rft.date=2006&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1093%2Fpublius%2Fpjj011&amp;rft.aulast=Gamble&amp;rft.aufirst=A.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-215"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-215">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation journal">Meehan, E. (1999). "The Belfast Agreement&#8212;Its Distinctiveness and Points of Cross-Fertilization in the UK\'s Devolution Programme". <i>Parliamentary Affairs</i>. <b>52</b> (1): 19&#8211;31 [p. 23]. <a href="/wiki/Digital_object_identifier" title="Digital object identifier">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="//doi.org/10.1093%2Fpa%2F52.1.19" rel="nofollow">10.1093/pa/52.1.19</a>. <q><a href="/wiki/T" title="T">The</a> distinctive involvement of two governments in the Northern Irish problem means that Northern Ireland\'s new arrangements rest upon an intergovernmental agreement. If this can be equated with a treaty, it could be argued that the forthcoming distribution of power between Westminster and Belfast has similarities with divisions specified in the written constitutions of federal states... Although the Agreement makes the general proviso that Westminster\'s \'powers to make legislation for Northern Ireland\' remains \'unaffected\', without an explicit categorical reference to reserved matters, it may be more difficult than in Scotland or Wales for devolved powers to be repatriated. The retraction of devolved powers would not merely entail consultation in Northern Ireland backed implicitly by the absolute power of parliamentary sovereignty but also the renegotiation of an intergovernmental agreement.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Parliamentary+Affairs&amp;rft.atitle=The+Belfast+Agreement%E2%80%94Its+Distinctiveness+and+Points+of+Cross-Fertilization+in+the+UK%27s+Devolution+Programme&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=19-31+p.+23&amp;rft.date=1999&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1093%2Fpa%2F52.1.19&amp;rft.aulast=Meehan&amp;rft.aufirst=E.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-216"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-216">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a class="external text" href="http://www.scotshistoryonline.co.uk/union.html" rel="nofollow">"The Treaty (act) of the Union of Parliament 1706"</a>. Scottish History Online<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">5 October</span> 2008</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=The+Treaty+%28act%29+of+the+Union+of+Parliament+1706&amp;rft.pub=Scottish+History+Online&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.scotshistoryonline.co.uk%2Funion.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-217"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-217">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation news"><a class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/8283939.stm" rel="nofollow">"UK Supreme Court judges sworn in"</a>. BBC News. 1 October 2009.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=UK+Supreme+Court+judges+sworn+in&amp;rft.date=2009-10-01&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.bbc.co.uk%2F1%2Fhi%2Fuk%2F8283939.stm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-218"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-218">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a class="external text" href="http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20090117132005/http://www.dca.gov.uk/consult/supremecourt/supreme.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Constitutional reform: A Supreme Court for the United Kingdom"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. Department for Constitutional Affairs. July 2003. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.dca.gov.uk/consult/supremecourt/supreme.pdf" rel="nofollow">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on 17 January 2009<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">13 May</span> 2013</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Constitutional+reform%3A+A+Supreme+Court+for+the+United+Kingdom&amp;rft.pub=Department+for+Constitutional+Affairs&amp;rft.date=2003-07&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.dca.gov.uk%2Fconsult%2Fsupremecourt%2Fsupreme.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-219"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-219">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a class="external text" href="http://www.jcpc.uk/about/role-of-the-jcpc.html" rel="nofollow">"Role of the JCPC"</a>. Judicial Committee of the Privy Council<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">28 April</span> 2013</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Role+of+the+JCPC&amp;rft.pub=Judicial+Committee+of+the+Privy+Council&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.jcpc.uk%2Fabout%2Frole-of-the-jcpc.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-220"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-220">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Bainham, Andrew (1998). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/?id=AF303DEl0MkC&amp;pg=PA298" rel="nofollow"><i>The international survey of family law: 1996</i></a>. The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff. p.&#160;298. <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-90-411-0573-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-90-411-0573-8">978-90-411-0573-8</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+international+survey+of+family+law%3A+1996&amp;rft.place=The+Hague&amp;rft.pages=298&amp;rft.pub=Martinus+Nijhoff&amp;rft.date=1998&amp;rft.isbn=978-90-411-0573-8&amp;rft.aulast=Bainham&amp;rft.aufirst=Andrew&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2F%3Fid%3DAF303DEl0MkC%26pg%3DPA298&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-221"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-221">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Adeleye, Gabriel; Acquah-Dadzie, Kofi; Sienkewicz, Thomas; McDonough, James (1999). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/?id=a4ddQNrt8e8C&amp;pg=PA371" rel="nofollow"><i>World dictionary of foreign expressions</i></a>. Waucojnda, IL: Bolchazy-Carducci. p.&#160;371. <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-86516-423-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-86516-423-9">978-0-86516-423-9</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=World+dictionary+of+foreign+expressions&amp;rft.place=Waucojnda%2C+IL&amp;rft.pages=371&amp;rft.pub=Bolchazy-Carducci&amp;rft.date=1999&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-86516-423-9&amp;rft.au=Adeleye%2C+Gabriel&amp;rft.au=Acquah-Dadzie%2C+Kofi&amp;rft.au=Sienkewicz%2C+Thomas&amp;rft.au=McDonough%2C+James&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2F%3Fid%3Da4ddQNrt8e8C%26pg%3DPA371&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r879151008" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-222"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-222">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20130414202207/http://alpn.edu.au/node/66" rel="nofollow">"The Australian courts and comparative law"</a>. Islands">&#197;land Islands</a>\n<ul><li><span style="font-size:90%;"><a href="/wiki/Autonomous_administrative_division" title="Autonomous administrative division">autonomous region</a> subject to the Agreement</a></span></li></ul></li></ul>\n</div></td></tr></tbody></table><div></div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3" style="text-align:left;"><div><div class="plainlist"><ul><li><sup>1</sup> <a href="/wiki/Island#Oceanic_islands" title="Island">Oceanic islands</a> within the vicinity of Europe are usually grouped with the continent even though they are not situated on its continental shelf.</li><li><sup>2</sup> Some countries completely outside the conventional geographical boundaries of Europe are commonly associated with the continent due to ethnological links.</li></ul></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>\n<div aria-labelledby="Commonwealth_realms_and_dominions" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table
